intro: Centaurium subspicatum, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spire-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in whorls around the stem.
